Template.Name: Rank by Position
Template.Description: Returns the rank of a specified tuple within a specified set, where the rank is based on the position of the tuple within the set.

Template.Name: Rank by Value
Template.Description: Returns the rank of a specified tuple within a specified set, with the rank determined by the value of a specified numeric expression.

Template.Name: Net Profit Margin
Template.Description: Divides net income by net sales. Net profit margin is also known as operating margin.

CalcMemberContent.Expression: <<Net Income>> / <<Net Sales>>

Template.Name: Budget Variance
Template.Description: Calculates the difference between the actual amount and the budgeted or planned amount.

Template.Name: Percentage of Total
Template.Description: Calculates the ratio of a specific member's value to the value of all members.

CalcMemberContent.Expression:
Case // Test to avoid division by zero. When IsEmpty ( [Measures].[<<Target Measure>>] ) Then Null
Else ( [<<Target Dimension>>].[<<Target Hierarchy>>].CurrentMember, [Measures].[<<Target Measure>>] ) / ( // The Root function returns the (All) value for the target dimension. Root ( [<<Target Dimension>>] ), [Measures].[<<Target Measure>>] )
End

Template.Name: Percentage of Parent
Template.Description: Calculates the ratio of a specific member's value to that of the member’s parent.

CalcMemberContent.Expression:
Case // Test to avoid division by zero. When IsEmpty ( [Measures].[<<Target Measure>>] ) Then Null
// Test for current coordinate being on the (All) member. When [<<Target Dimension>>].[<<Target Hierarchy>>].CurrentMember.Level Is [<<Target Dimension>>].[<<Target Hierarchy>>].[(All)] Then 1
Else ( [<<Target Dimension>>].[<<Target Hierarchy>>].CurrentMember, [Measures].[<<Target Measure>>] ) / ( [<<Target Dimension>>].[<<Target Hierarchy>>].CurrentMember.Parent, [Measures].[<<Target Measure>>] )
End

Template.Name: Filtered Set of Attribute Members
Template.Description: Defines a set of attribute members that exist within the values of another attribute.

Template.Name: Filter by Member Property Value
Template.Description: Filters the members of a set based on the value of a member property.

Template.Name: Filter by Attribute Value
Template.Description: Filters the members of one attribute based on existence with the value of another attribute in the same dimension.

Template.Name: Top N Percent
Template.Description: Sorts a set, and then returns the specified number of topmost members whose cumulative total is at least the specified percentage.

Template.Name: Top N Count
Template.Description: Returns a specified number of items from the topmost members of a specified set.

Template.Name: Bottom N Count
Template.Description: Returns a specified number of items from the bottommost members of a specified set.

Template.Name: Bottom N Percent
Template.Description: Sorts a set, and then returns the specified number of bottommost members whose cumulative total is at least the specified percentage.

Template.Name: Present Value
Template.Description: Calculates the present value of a sum of money to be received at a future date.

CalcMemberContent.Expression:
<<Future Value>>
/
(1 + i)^t

// This expression defines the present value of a sum of money to be
// received at a future date.

// i represents the annual interest rate.
// t represents the number of years.

Template.Name: Future Value
Template.Description: Calculates the future value of a sum of money invested for a specific number of years, assuming credit and reinvestment of interest.

CalcMemberContent.Expression:
<<Present Value>>(1 + i)^t

// This expression defines the future value of a sum of money 
// invested for specific number of years, assuming credit and reinvestment of interest. 

// i represents the annual interest rate.
// t represents the number of years.

Template.Name: Gross Profit
Template.Description: Calculates the difference between the net sales revenue and the cost of goods sold.

CalcMemberContent.Expression: <<Net Sales>> - <<Cost of Goods Sold>>

Template.Name: Gross Profit Margin
Template.Description: Calculates the difference between net sales and the cost of goods sold, expressed as a percentage of net sales.

CalcMemberContent.Expression: <<Net Sales>> - <<Cost of Goods Sold>> / <<Net Sales>>

Template.Name: Net Sales
Template.Description: Calculates the gross sales less returns, discounts, and allowances.

CalcMemberContent.Expression: <<Gross Sales>> - ( <<Total Returns>> + <<Total Discounts>> + <<Total Allowances>> )

Template.Name: Net Income
Template.Description: Calculates total earnings less operating expenses, taxes, interest, depreciation and other expenses.

CalcMemberContent.Expression:
<<Gross Profit>> - ( <<Operating Expenses>> + <<Tax Expense>> + <<Interest>> + <<Depreciation>> )
// Any additional relevant expenses that should be included.

Template.Name: Economic Value Added (EVA)
Template.Description: Defines a measure of economic performance that is based on the enterprise’s net profits less a deduction for the consumption of capital.

CalcMemberContent.Expression: <<Net operating Profit after tax>> – ( <<Capital>> * <<Cost of Capital>> )

Template.Name: Days Sales Outstanding (DSO)
Template.Description: Shows the age, typically in days, of an enterprise's accounts receivable and the average time that it takes to transform receivables into cash.

CalcMemberContent.Expression: <<Receivables at Periods End>> / <<Sales Credited within Period>> * <<Number of Days in Period>>

Template.Name: Periods to Date
Template.Description: Returns the aggregate of a numeric expression from the start of a specified period to the current period.

Template.Name: Period over Period
Template.Description: Compares the value of a numeric expression in one period, typically the current period, to a previous period.

CalcMemberContent.Expression:
Case // Test for current coordinate being on (All) member. When [<<Target Dimension>>].[<<Target Hierarchy>>].CurrentMember.Level Is [<<Target Dimension>>].[<<Target Hierarchy>>].[(All)]
Then "NA"
Else ( [<<Target Dimension>>].[<<Target Hierarchy>>].CurrentMember, [Measures].[<<Target Measure>>] ) - ( ParallelPeriod ( [<<Target Dimension>>].[<<Target Hierarchy>>].[<<Target Level>>], <<Number of Periods>>, [<<Target Dimension>>].[<<Target Hierarchy>>].CurrentMember ), [Measures].[<<Target Measure>>] ) End
// This expression evaluates the difference between the value of the numeric // expression in the previous period and that of the current period.

Template.Name: Period over Period Growth
Template.Description: Compares the value of a numeric expression in one period to a previous period, as a percentage of the previous period’s value.

Template.Name: Closing Period Balance
Template.Description: Returns the value of the last sibling among the descendants of a specific member at a specified level.

Template.Name: Opening Period Balance
Template.Description: Returns the value of the first sibling among the descendants of a specified member at a specified level.

Template.Name: Moving Average
Template.Description: Returns the average value of a member over a specified time interval.

CalcMemberContent.Expression:
Avg ( [<<Target Dimension>>].[<<Target Hierarchy>>].CurrentMember.Lag(<<Periods to Lag>>) : [<<Target Dimension>>].[<<Target Hierarchy>>].CurrentMember, [Measures].[<<Target Measure>>] )
// This calculation returns the average value of a member over the specified time interval.

Template.Name: Display Map
Template.Description: Displays a map for a selected cube object.

Template.Name: Search for Term
Template.Description: Searches the Internet for a selected cube object.

Template.Name: View Report
Template.Description: Launches a SQL Server Reporting Services report for a selected cube object.

Template.Name: Customer Retention Rate
Template.Description: Calculates the percentage of customers that are retained based on the number of customers that are lost in a specific period.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: ( 1- ( <<Number of Customers Lost>> / <<Total Number of Customers>> ) ) * 100
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Customer Retention Rate goal.*/ <<Customer Retention Rate Goal>>
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the ratio of customers that are retained to customers that are lost within in a specific period.

Template.Name: Customer Satisfaction
Template.Description: Calculates and tracks the ratio of satisfied customers to the total number of customers.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Customer Satisfaction goal.*/ <<Customer Satisfaction Goal>>
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) tracks the ratio of satisfied customers to the total number of customers. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Customer Profitability
Template.Description: Tracks the profitability of individual customers and customer groups.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: <<Budgeted Sales>> - <<Cost of Good Sold Forecast>>
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the profitability of individual customers and customer groups. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: New Accounts per Period
Template.Description: Calculates the percentage of new customers to the total number of customers.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: <<Number of New Customers>> / <<Total Number of Customers>> *100
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your goal for new customer acquisitions.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the ratio of new customers to the total number of customers. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Lost Accounts per Period
Template.Description: Calculates the ratio of customer turnover to the total number of customers.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: <<Number of Lost Customers>> / <<Total Number of Customers>> *100
KPIContent.GoalExpression: 0 /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Customer Turnover goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the ratio of customer turnover to the total number of customers. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the less than sign (<) to a greater than sign (>) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Turnover
Template.Description: Calculates the ratio of employee turnover to the total number of employees.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: <<Number of Employee Departures>> / <<Total Number of Employees>> *100
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your percentage of customer turnover goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the ratio of employee turnover to the total number of employees. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the less than sign (<) to a greater than sign (>) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Absenteeism
Template.Description: Calculates the ratio of lost work days to total possible work days.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: <<Number of Days out>> / <<Number of Days in the Month>> *100
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the ratio of lost work days to total possible work days. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the less than sign (<) to a greater than sign (>) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Headcount Part Time/Employee Base
Template.Description: Calculates the percentage of part-time employees over the entire employee base.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: <<Number of Part Time Employees>> / <<Total Number of Employees>> *100
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Headcount Part Time/Employee Base goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the percentage of part time employees over the entire employee base. The Status and Trend expressions assume a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the less than sign (<) to the greater than sign (>) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Headcount Full Time/Employee Base
Template.Description: Calculates the percentage of full-time employees over the entire employee base.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: <<Number of Full Time Employees>> / <<Total number of Employees>> *100
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Headcount Full Time/Employee Base goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the percentage of full-time employees over the entire employee base. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Average Length of Employment
Template.Description: Calculates the average length of employment based on the total number of employees, regardless of whether the employees are full- or part-time.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Average Length of Employment goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the average length of employment based on the total number of employees, regardless of whether the employees are full- or part-time. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Employee Satisfaction Index
Template.Description: Tracks the satisfaction of the employee base.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Employee Satisfaction Index goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) template tracks the satisfaction of the employee base. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Training Cost/Employee
Template.Description: Calculates last year's training cost per employee less ten percent.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: 0.9* ( <<Training Cost>>, ParallelPeriod ( [<<Time Dimension Name>>].[<<Time Hierarchy Name>>].[<<Time Year Level Name>>], 1, [<<Time Dimension Name>>].[<<Time Hierarchy Name>>].CurrentMember ) ) / ( <<Total Number of Employees>>, ParallelPeriod ( [<<Time Dimension Name>>].[<<Time Hierarchy Name>>].[<<Time Year Level Name>>], 1, [<<Time Dimension Name>>].[<<Time Hierarchy Name>>].CurrentMember ) )
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) is based on last year's training cost/employee less ten percent. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the less than sign (<) to the greater than sign (>) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Training Hours/Employee
Template.Description: Calculates last year's training hours per employee less ten percent.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: 0.9 * ( <<Training Hours>>, ParallelPeriod ( [<<Time Dimension Name>>].[<<Time Hierarchy Name>>].[<<Time Year Level Name>>], 1, [<<Time Dimension Name>>].[<<Time Hierarchy Name>>].CurrentMember ) ) / ( <<Total Number of Employees>>, ParallelPeriod ( [<<Time Dimension Name>>].[<<Time Hierarchy Name>>].[<<Time Year Level Name>>], 1, [<<Time Dimension Name>>].[<<Time Hierarchy Name>>].CurrentMember ) )
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) is based on last year's training hours per employee less ten percent. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the less than sign (<) to the greater than sign (>) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Average Salary by Job Title
Template.Description: Divides the total salary of all employees in a job title by the number of employees with that job title. This KPI assumes that a hierarchy exists with the list of job titles, and that this hierarchy is separate from the employee dimension.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: (<<Salary>>,[<<Employee Dimension>>].[<<Employee Hierarchy>>].[<<Employee Hierarchy All Member>>] )/<<Total number of Employee>>
KPIContent.GoalExpression: <<Target Average Salary per Job Title>>
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) that divides the total salary of all employees in that job title divided by the number of employees with that job title. This KPI assumes that a hierarchy exists with the list of job titles, and that this hierarchy is separate from the employee dimension. For each job title, the KPI takes the total salary of all employees in that job title and divides by the number of employees with that job title. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the less than sign (<) to a greater than sign (>) in these expressions.

Template.Name: On-Time Delivery Percentage
Template.Description: Calculates the on-time delivery percentage based on the ratio of on-time deliveries to the total number of deliveries.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: 1 /* Here 1 represents an on-time delivery goal of 100%. This value can be changed if you have a different on-time delivery percentage goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the on-time delivery percentage based on the ratio of on-time deliveries to the total number of deliveries. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Late Delivery Percentage
Template.Description: Calculates the late delivery percentage based on the ratio of late deliveries to the total number of deliveries.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: 0 /* Here 0 represents a late delivery percentage goal of 0%. This value can be changed if you have a different late delivery percentage goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the late delivery percentage based on the ratio of late deliveries to the total number of deliveries. The Status and Trend expressions assume that the a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the < sign by > in these expressions.

Template.Name: Shipping Cost/Total Cost
Template.Description: Calculates the percentage of the shipping cost to the total cost of the finished product.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Shipping Cost/Total Cost goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the percentage of the shipping cost to the total cost of the finished product. The Status and Trend expressions assume that the a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the < sign by > in these expressions.

Template.Name: Order Backlog Percent
Template.Description: Tracks the order backlog metric per product and region.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: <<Order Backlog>> / ( <<Order Backlog>>, Root( [<<Product Dimension>>] ), Root( [<<Region Dimension>>] ) )
KPIContent.GoalExpression: 0 /*0 represents an Order Backlog Percentage goal of 0%. This can be a fixed value if you know your Order Backlog Percent goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) tracks the order backlog metric per product and region. The Status and Trend expressions assume that the a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the < sign by > in these expressions.

Template.Name: Economic Value Added (EVA)
Template.Description: Calculates a financial performance measure that tries to capture the true economic profit of an enterprise.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: <<Net Operating Profit After Tax>> – ( <<Capital>> * <<Cost of Capital>> )
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Economic Value Added (EVA) goal.*/ <<EVA Goal>>
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) is a financial performance measure that tries to capture the true economic profit of an enterprise. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Market Share
Template.Description: Calculates a financial performance measure that tries to track the Market share index.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Market Share goal.*/ <<Market Share goal>>
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) tries to track the Market share index. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Days of Sales Outstanding (DSO)
Template.Description: Measures the days of sales outstanding.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: <<Unit in stock quantity>>/<<Average sales per day>>
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Days of Sales Outstanding (DSO) goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) template measures the days of sales outstanding. The Status and Trend expressions assume that the a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the < sign by > in these expressions.

Template.Name: Sales/Industry Sales Percent
Template.Description: Tracks the performance of the company sales compared to the industry.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Sales/Industry Sales Percent goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) tracks the performance of the company sales compared to the industry. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Sales Growth vs. Industry Sales Growth
Template.Description: Tracks the performance of the company sales growth compared to the industry growth.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Sales Growth vs. Industry Sales Growth goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) tracks the performance of the company sales growth compared to the industry growth. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Budget Variance
Template.Description: Tracks the variance between actual and budget data.

KPIContent.ValueExpression:
Case When IsEmpty ( ( [Measures].[<<measure Name>>] [<<Scenario Dimension>>].[<<Scenario Hierarchy>>].[<<Budget Member>>] ) ) Then "Not Budgeted"
When [<<Account Dimension>>].[<<Account Type Hierarchy>>].CurrentMember Is [<<Account Dimension>>].[<<Account Type Hierarchy>>].[<<Expense Member>>] Or [<<Account Dimension>>].[<<Account Type Hierarchy>>].CurrentMember Is [<<Account Dimension>>].[<<Account Type>>].[<<Liabilities Member>>]
Then ( [Measures].[<<measure Name>>],[<<Scenario Dimension>>].[<<Scenario Hierarchy>>].[<<Budget Member>>] ) - ( [Measures].[<<measure Name>>],[<<Scenario Dimension>>].[<<Scenario Hierarchy>>].[<<Actual Member>>] )
Else ( [Measures].[<<measure Name>>],[<<Scenario Dimension>>].[<<Scenario Hierarchy>>].[<<Actual Member>>] ) - ( [Measures].[<<measure Name>>],[<<Scenario Dimension>>].[<<Scenario Hierarchy>>].[<<Budget Member>>] ) End
KPIContent.GoalExpression: 0 /*0 represents the variance thresholds that can be tolerated. This value can be changed to any threshold that meets your business needs.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) tracks the variance between actual and budget data. The Trend expression also assumes that a lower value is better. If this is not the case, may need to change the < sign by > in these expressions.

Template.Name: Net Income
Template.Description: Tracks the performance of the net income account.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Net Income goal, or this expression can be a measure or even the same expression as the Value expression if your cube contains data for actual and budget scenarios.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) tracks the performance of the net income account. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Earnings Per Share
Template.Description: Calculates the earnings per share, which represents the profit that is accruing to stockholders for each share held.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: ( <<Net Income>> – <<Preferred Dividends>> ) / <<Weighted Average Common Stock Outstanding>>
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Earning Per Share (EPS) goal, or this expression can be a measure or even the same expression as the Value expression if your cube holds data for actual and budget scenarios.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the earnings per share, which represents the profit that is accruing to stockholders for each share held. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Basic Earnings Per Share
Template.Description: Calculates the basic earnings per share, which represents the profit that is accruing to stockholders for both each share held and any common stock equivalents.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: (<<Net Income>> – <<Preferred Dividends>>) / (<<Weighted Average Common Stock Outstanding>> + <<Common Stock Equivalents>>)
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Basic Earnings Per Share goal, or this expression can be a measure or even the same expression as the Value expression if your cube hold data for actual and budget scenarios.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the basic earnings per share, which represents the profit that is accruing to stockholders for both each share held and any common stock equivalents. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Diluted Earnings Per Share
Template.Description: Calculates the diluted earnings per share, which represents the profit that is accruing to stockholders for both each share held and any diluted securities.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: (<<Net Income>> – <<Preferred Dividends>>) / (<<Weighted Average Common Stock Outstanding>> + <<Diluted Securities>>)
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Diluted Earnings Per Share goal, or this expression can be a measure or even the same expression as the Value expression if your cube hold data for actual and budget scenarios.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the diluted earnings per share, which represents the profit that is accruing to stockholders for both each share held and any diluted securities. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: P/E Ratio
Template.Description: Calculates the price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your P/E Ratio goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the P/E ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Price/Sales Ratio
Template.Description: Calculates the price-to-sales ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Price/Sales Ratio goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the price-to-sales ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Price/Cash Flow Ratio
Template.Description: Calculates the price-to-cash flow ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Price/Sales Ratio goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the price-to-cash flow ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Liquidity Ratio
Template.Description: Calculates the liquidity ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. This ratio tries to determine whether a firm is maintaining an appropriate level of liquidity.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Liquidity Ratio goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the liquidity ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Quick Ratio
Template.Description: Calculates the quick ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. This ratio places the emphasis on the firm’s short term viability (that is, the firm’s ability to stay in business).

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Quick Ratio goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the quick ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Stockholders Equity
Template.Description: Calculates the stockholders equity or capital, and tracks this value’s performance against the corporate objective. This value represents the bottom line of the balance sheet.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Stockholders Equity goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the stockholders equity and track this value's performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Book Value / Share
Template.Description: Calculates the book value per share and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Book Value / Share goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the book value per share and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Dividend Yield
Template.Description: Calculates the dividend yield and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Dividend Yield goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the dividend yield and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Dividend Payout
Template.Description: Calculates the dividend payout and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Dividend Payout goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the dividend payout and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Receivables Turnover Ratio
Template.Description: Calculates the receivables turnover ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. This indicator measures the efficiency in collecting receivables.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Receivables Turnover Ratio goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the receivables turnover ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Days Receivables
Template.Description: Calculates the days receivables and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. Days receivable is the average age of receivables (that is, the average length of time to collect receivables).

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Days Receivables goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the days receivables and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions assume that the a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the less than sign (<) to the greater than sign (>) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Inventory Turnover Ratio
Template.Description: Calculates the inventory turnover ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. This indicator measures the efficiency in keeping a small inventory in house.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Inventory Turnover Ratio goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the inventory turnover ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Days Inventory
Template.Description: Calculates the days inventory and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. Days inventory is the average age of inventory.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Days Inventory goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the days inventory and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions assume that the a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the less than sign (<) to the greater than sign (>) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Asset Turnover
Template.Description: Calculates the asset turnover and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Asset Turnover goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the asset turnover and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Interest Coverage
Template.Description: Calculates the interest coverage and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Interest Coverage goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the interest coverage and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Debt Ratio
Template.Description: Calculates the debt ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Debt Ratio goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the debt ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions assume that the a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the less than sign (<) to the greater than sign (>) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Debt to Equity Ratio
Template.Description: Calculates the debt-to-equity ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. This ratio determines if the firm has overextended itself through the use of financial leverage. Does the firm have principal and interest payment obligations exceeding the firm’s ability to pay, not only now but into the future as well? This ratio focuses on the protective cushion that owner’s equity provides for creditors.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Debt to Equity Ratio goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the debt-to-equity ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions assume that the a lower value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the less than sign (<) to the greater than sign (>) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Interest Earned Over Time
Template.Description: Calculates the interest earned over time and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Interest Earned Over Time goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the interest earned over time and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Cash Flow to Assets Ratio
Template.Description: Calculates the cash flow–to-assets ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. This indicator measures the ability of assets to generate operating cash flows.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: <<Net Cash flow from operating activities>> / <<average total assets>>
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Cash Flow to Assets Ratio goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the cash flow-to-assets ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Cash Flow to Sales Ratio
Template.Description: Calculates the cash flow-to-sales ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. This indicator measures the ability of sales to generate operating cash flows.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Cash Flow to Sales Ratio goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the cash flow-to-sales ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Cash flow to Capital Expenditures Ratio
Template.Description: Calculates the cash flow-to-capital expenditures ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. This indicator measures the ability of a company to maintain plant and equipment from the cash provided by operations, instead of by borrowing or issuing new stock.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: ( <<Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities>>-<<Dividends>> ) / <<Expenditures for Plant and Equipment>>
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Cash Flow to Capital Expenditures Ratio goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the cash flow-to-capital expenditures ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Cash Flow to Total Debt Ratio
Template.Description: Calculates the cash flow-to-total debt ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. This indicator measures the ability of the firm to pay its debts. This indicator helps predict a bankruptcy.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: <<Net Cash flow from operating activities>> / <<Total liabilities>>
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Cash Flow to Total Debt Ratio goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the cash flow-to-total debt ratio and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Cash Flow Yield
Template.Description: Calculates the cash flow yield and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. This indicator measures the ability of the firm to generate operating cash flows in relation to net income.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: <<Net Cash flow from operating activities>> / <<Net Income>>
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Cash Flow Yield goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the cash flow yield and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Goodwill
Template.Description: Calculates the goodwill of the company and tracks this value’s performance against the corporate objective. This KPI represents the value of a company’s name and reputation, its customer relations, and other factors that would produce better-than-typical future earnings.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Goodwill goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the goodwill of the company and tracks this value’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Gross Profit Margin
Template.Description: Calculates the gross profit margin and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The gross profit margin is calculated by dividing gross profit by net sales.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Gross Profit Margin goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the gross profit margin and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Net Profit Margin
Template.Description: Calculates the net profit margin and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. Also known as operating margin, the net profit margin is calculated by dividing net income by net sales. The value, expressed as a percentage, represents how much of every dollar in revenue results in net income.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Net Profit Margin goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the net profit margin and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Operating Margin
Template.Description: Calculates the operating margin and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The operating margin is calculated by dividing operating income by sales.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Operating Margin goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the operating margin and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Pre-Tax Margin
Template.Description: Calculates the pre-tax margin and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The pre-tax margin is calculated by dividing income before tax by sales.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Pre-Tax Margin goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the pre-tax margin and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Return On Assets
Template.Description: Calculates the return on assets and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The return on assets is calculated by dividing net income by total assets.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Return On Assets goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the return on assets and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Return On Equity
Template.Description: Calculates the return on equity and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The return on equity is calculated by dividing net income by stockholders equity.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Return On Equity goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the return on equity and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Residual Income
Template.Description: Calculates the amount of money left over after the company has paid all of its ordinary and necessary debts.

KPIContent.ValueExpression: <<Project Profit>> - (<<Amount of Assets investments required>> * <<ROA Rate>>)
KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Residual Income goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the amount of money left over after the company has paid all of its ordinary and necessary debts. The Status and Trend expressions assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Revenue Per Employee
Template.Description: Calculates the revenue per employee and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Revenue Per Employee goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the revenue per employee and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.

Template.Name: Income Per Employee
Template.Description: Calculates the income per employee and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective.

KPIContent.GoalExpression: /*This can be a fixed value if you know your Income Per Employee goal.*/
KPIContent.Description: This key performance indicator (KPI) calculates the income per employee and tracks this ratio’s performance against the corporate objective. The Status and Trend expressions also assume that a higher value is better. If this is not the case, you may need to change the greater than sign (>) to the less than sign (<) in these expressions.
